1111.content:
Jenny flashed a big, toothy smile and said, "Sure, why not?"

The manager, a beefy man by the name of Gus, looked down at her application, "What style of massage do you specialize in?"

Uh-oh. There were different styles of massage? Jenny furrowed her brows and asked, "Style?"

"Mm," Gus nodded, still appraising her application, "what school did go to? How much experience do you have?"

A hot wave of embarrassment flashed over her cheeks and neck. She should have left right then, she knew, but somehow she stuck around, cooking up some sort of lie to get her in the door. There was no reason for her to want a job so badly for which she possessed only a profound ignorance.

"I practice the Wushu style."

Gus scowled and finally looked up at her, "Wushu?"

Jenny's brother had made her watch Jet Li's Fearless on DVD the previous night, and the lie just tumbled from her mouth. To her horror, the tumbling continued, "It's a new Nordic massage technique -- like Swedish, but gentler. I've been perfecting this new style for the last 18 months."

Gus scratched his chin, "I don't know."

"Look, to prove to you, let me massage you. I promise it'll be the best massage ever."

Gus grunted, "Hardly. I don't allow people to touch me."

Interesting, Jenny grimaced. Not helpful, but interesting.

"Well, pick out one of your staff, and I'll Wushu the crap out of 'em!"

Gus rubbed his chin and thought about the offer.
1111.title: A New Career Path?

"Well," he said, "my name is Robert, and it's been lovely talking with you." Jenny chewed her lower lip for a moment, trying to think quickly. On the one hand, she felt like she didn't want this to be the last time she ever saw him, and on the other, well, she knew a girl has to be careful these days. Finally she decided that telling him her name couldn't hurt anything...so, she smiled up at him and said, "Well, my name is Jenny...and....I hope I'll run into you again sometime." "Well, you will if you decide to take advantage of the special they're running at that massage parlour you saw advertised back there, I'm the certified massage therapist." Oooooooh, Jenny smiled to herself...now she KNEW she would have to look into THIS....
As her gaze unwittingly shifted to his hands, she thought of the warm little shiver that she'd gotten when he'd helped her off the train and ever so slightly squeezed her hand while he'd been holding it. Well, now they were at the parking lot of the train station, and Jenny looked back into his eyes (which were twinkling), and blushing, offered her hand for a goodbye handshake. "Well, it's been nice...and I'll give a visit to your place some thought" she said, smiling to herself and thinking "oooh, better not let him guess just how much thought I'll be giving it!"

12.title: An Offer

choices: This is Jenny's stop also

121.content:
"Well, my problem is definitely NOT unemployment, though at times I wish it were, Mr. uh....?" The man smiled, "please excuse me if you find me forward, My name is Robert. I'm the owner, manager and massage therapist at that place" he said, indicating a poster advertisement right behind Jenny's head. "And although we'd hopefully keep you pretty busy as a receptionist, well" he smiled "one of the job benefits WOULD be stress relief."
Jenny was intrigued, and although her common sense told her some caution should be exercised here, she smiled and asked how much the job would pay, as she wondered how it was he even thought her line of work was secretarial. "Oh, you can always tell a secretary" Robert said, seeming to read her thoughts, "by the 'uniform', for one thing, and by the stress in their backs and facial muscles on the train ride home at the end of the day, for another. The best ones always seem to be taking their work home with them." Jenny smiled at this wonderfully handsome (how had she missed it before?) man across the aisle from her. "Ah, there, that's better." Robert smiled back. Jenny took a deep breath and made a quick decision to throw caution to the wind. "So, tell me more about this job" she said. Then she frowned as she thought about all the loose ends she would have to tie up at the office. Gosh, was she really considering quitting her job? All of a sudden, she thought of the complications that would arise working for such a handsome boss. And here she didn't even know anything about this guy, besides what he'd told her. Could she take him at face value, or not? "Oh...well" Robert said, clearing his throat, "I realize this whole idea would require a little research and consideration on your part." He had been watching the emotions on her face. Wow, did they show, he thought, smiling to himself. At the same time, he realized he'd perhaps better take a step back, so to speak, if he was going to get a chance to get to know this lovely girl. And boy, did he want to, he realized all of a sudden, in a moment of surprise at himself. And now the train was coming to a stop...his stop, and he found himself wishing it were a longer way. He rose from his seat, and handing her one of his business cards, said, "Well, do look into it, if you'd like." Thinking that was all the more he dared to say at the moment. Jenny smiled and accepted the card, tucking it into her purse.
121.title: Surprise Job Offer

12111.content:
Jenny's mouth began to water as she watched him methodically and patiently slice the cake, even as she wondered what in the world he could be up to with it, her brain tantalized by some of the possibilities she came up with.

Her questions were soon answered, however, as Robert brought the plate full of luscious, velvety frosted cubes to the coffee table, and sat down next to her on the edge of the couch. Placing one hand softly on her cheek, letting his fingers penetrate into the lovely softness of her hair, he reached for one of the bites of cake and brought it to rest on her lips, his fingers slightly probing into her mouth. Even as her breathing became more labored and ragged, she giggled and playfully bit his fingers before accepting the morsel. Then she picked up a piece of the cake and started to feed it to him, but smiled as she held it back a little, saying "Now don't feel like you have to bite back...at least not too hard!" Robert grabbed her wrist gently and took the cake from her himself, and keeping her hand there after he'd finished eating the cake, he placed each of her fingers alternately into his mouth, making sure absolutely no frosting could be left on them as he sucked them clean. "O.K., I won't bite too hard," he said as he turned her palm to his lips and kissed it softly. Jenny couldn't keep herself from trembling as he then let his tongue escape from his mouth to stroke and press into her palm with it, making tiny little circles.

As she felt his moustache tickling its way up her arm as he placed kiss after kiss on it, marking, so it seemed, every half inch of the way up, Jenny let herself lean backwards and allowed herself to be swallowed up by the deliciousness of it all.

Robert paused to smile at her, realizing she was assenting for him to go as far as he would like.

So it was that the next morning, Jenny awoke to find herself in a strange appartment, in the arms of a man she'd only met yesterday. To her consternation, common sense was annoying her now, fighting with the feelings of total satisfaction she had experienced the night before. What would happen next, she wondered.

Just then, the phone rang, waking Robert. First smiling at her and giving her a good morning kiss, he reached over her to pick up the cordless phone that was resting on a nightstand.

"Hello," he spoke into the phone as he stroked her hair. She propped herself up on her elbow and looked at him questioningly, but his smile turned into a worried look as he got out of the bed and walked out of the room with the phone.

choices: Will Jenny remain and have a look around?
Or will she gather her clothes and leave quickly, (this is too strange for her)?
1211121.content:
Robert stands slowly, his eyes focused elsewhere and turns to his closet. Dressing himself, slowly and with care, he seems to have forgotten her for a moment.

She sinks back into bed, pulling up the covers. Jenny begins to wonder if perhaps, she'd made the wrong choice. What on earth could it be? What could they want with him? A thousand dreadful possibilities filled her consciousness in that short time it took him to dress.

But he returns to her, leaning carefully across the bed and takes her hand. Kissing it gently, he strokes her arm and looks up at her with large beautiful eyes.

"I'll only be a moment, I promise. I hope this doesn't upset you, for surely I can explain everything upon my return," he sooths her.

"Spend as much time as you like here. There is a robe behind the door and feel free to take something from my wardrobe for now. Make yourself at home," he leans in and kisses her confusion creased forehead.

"Do not worry. I'll be back soon."

And with that he leaves, taking with him his watch, briefcase from near the door, and his cell phone and keys on the way out.

Jenny leans up on her arm and blinks at the situation. How quickly he had spoken, so softly it smoothed all worry from her. But now, in his absence, the reality of this begins to sneak back in.

She rises slowly, stretching and looking around. Taking the robe and tying it carefully she treads softly on the light carpeting to the living room.

And now she has a moment to think.
1211121.title: A moment to think
